headline.main: Moderate Activity Said to Cut Heart Deaths in Men at Risk

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Middle-aged men at high risk of heart disease who engage in moderate physical activities such as walking, gardening, yard work and swimming reduce their chances of death from heart attack by one-third, a new study has found.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Middle-aged men at high risk of heart disease who engage in moderate physical activities such as walking, gardening, yard work and swimming reduce their chances of death from heart attack by one-third, a new study has found.
